header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/args.hpp
header.para: Contains definition of args<> class template.

struct.name: args0
struct.purpose: A type sequence, for use as the 2nd parameter to the expr<> class template.

description.para: A type sequence, for use as the 2nd parameter to the expr<> class template. The types in the sequence correspond to the children of a node in an expression tree.

struct.name: args1
struct.purpose: A type sequence, for use as the 2nd parameter to the expr<> class template.

description.para: A type sequence, for use as the 2nd parameter to the expr<> class template. The types in the sequence correspond to the children of a node in an expression tree.

struct.name: args2
struct.purpose: A type sequence, for use as the 2nd parameter to the expr<> class template.

description.para: A type sequence, for use as the 2nd parameter to the expr<> class template. The types in the sequence correspond to the children of a node in an expression tree.

struct.name: args3
struct.purpose: A type sequence, for use as the 2nd parameter to the expr<> class template.

description.para: A type sequence, for use as the 2nd parameter to the expr<> class template. The types in the sequence correspond to the children of a node in an expression tree.

struct.name: args4
struct.purpose: A type sequence, for use as the 2nd parameter to the expr<> class template.

description.para: A type sequence, for use as the 2nd parameter to the expr<> class template. The types in the sequence correspond to the children of a node in an expression tree.

struct.name: args5
struct.purpose: A type sequence, for use as the 2nd parameter to the expr<> class template.

description.para: A type sequence, for use as the 2nd parameter to the expr<> class template. The types in the sequence correspond to the children of a node in an expression tree.

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/context.hpp
header.para: Includes all the context classes in the context/ sub-directory.

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/context/callable.hpp
header.para: Definintion of callable_context<>, an evaluation context for proto::eval() that explodes each node and calls the derived context type with the expressions constituents. If the derived context doesn't have an overload that handles this node, fall-back to the default_context. TODO: make the fall-back configurable!

description.para: callable_eval
callable_context
callable_context::eval

typedef.name: result_type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< Context(typename Expr::proto_tag, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 0 >::const_reference)>::type

typedef.name: result_type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< Context(typename Expr::proto_tag, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 0 >::const_reference)>::type

typedef.name: result_type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< Context(typename Expr::proto_tag, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 0 >::const_reference, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 1 >::const_reference)>::type

typedef.name: result_type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< Context(typename Expr::proto_tag, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 0 >::const_reference, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 1 >::const_reference, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 2 >::const_reference)>::type

typedef.name: result_type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< Context(typename Expr::proto_tag, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 0 >::const_reference, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 1 >::const_reference, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 2 >::const_reference, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 3 >::const_reference)>::type

typedef.name: result_type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< Context(typename Expr::proto_tag, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 0 >::const_reference, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 1 >::const_reference, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 2 >::const_reference, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 3 >::const_reference, typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 4 >::const_reference)>::type

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/context/default.hpp
header.para: Definintion of default_context, a default evaluation context for proto::eval() that uses Boost.Typeof to deduce return types of the built-in operators.

description.para: default_context
default_context::eval

typedef.name: result_type
typedef.type: mpl::if_< is_const < Expr >, typename proto::result_of::arg< Expr >::const_reference, typename proto::result_of::arg< Expr >::reference >::type

typedef.name: result_type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< function_type(typename proto::result_of::eval< typename remove_reference< typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 1 >::type >::type, Context >::type)>::type

typedef.name: result_type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< function_type(typename proto::result_of::eval< typename remove_reference< typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 1 >::type >::type, Context >::type, typename proto::result_of::eval< typename remove_reference< typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 2 >::type >::type, Context >::type)>::type

typedef.name: result_type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< function_type(typename proto::result_of::eval< typename remove_reference< typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 1 >::type >::type, Context >::type, typename proto::result_of::eval< typename remove_reference< typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 2 >::type >::type, Context >::type, typename proto::result_of::eval< typename remove_reference< typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 3 >::type >::type, Context >::type)>::type

typedef.name: result_type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< function_type(typename proto::result_of::eval< typename remove_reference< typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 1 >::type >::type, Context >::type, typename proto::result_of::eval< typename remove_reference< typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 2 >::type >::type, Context >::type, typename proto::result_of::eval< typename remove_reference< typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 3 >::type >::type, Context >::type, typename proto::result_of::eval< typename remove_reference< typename proto::result_of::arg_c< Expr, 4 >::type >::type, Context >::type)>::type

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/context/null.hpp
header.para: Definintion of null_context<>, an evaluation context for proto::eval() that simply evaluates each child expression, doesn't combine the results at all, and returns void.

description.para: null_context
null_context::eval

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/debug.hpp
header.para: Utilities for debugging Proto expression trees

struct.name: display_expr
struct.purpose: Pretty-print a Proto expression tree.

description.para: A PolymorphicFunctionObject which accepts a Proto expression tree and pretty-prints it to an ostream for debugging purposes.

method.name: operator()
method.purpose: Pretty-print the current node in a Proto expression tree.

description.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.
The starting indentation depth for this node. Children nodes will be displayed at a starting depth of depth+4.
The ostream to which the expression tree will be written.

signature.type: void

description.para: The Proto expression tree to pretty-print
The ostream to which the output should be written.

signature.type: void

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/deep_copy.hpp
header.para: Replace all nodes stored by reference by nodes stored by value.

struct.name: deep_copy
struct.purpose: A PolymorphicFunctionObject type for deep-copying Proto expression trees.

description.para: A PolymorphicFunctionObject type for deep-copying Proto expression trees. When a tree is deep-copied, all internal nodes and most terminals held by reference are instead held by value.

typedef.name: type
typedef.type: result_of::deep_copy< typename boost::remove_const < typename boost::remove_reference< Expr >::type >::type >::type

method.name: operator()
method.purpose: Deep-copies a Proto expression tree, turning all nodes and terminals held by reference into ones held by value.

struct.name: deep_copy
struct.purpose: A metafunction for calculating the return type of proto::deep_copy().

description.para: A metafunction for calculating the return type of proto::deep_copy(). The type parameter Expr should be the type of a Proto expression tree. It should not be a reference type, nor should it be cv-qualified.

data-member.name: deep_copy
data-member.purpose: A PolymorphicFunctionObject for deep-copying Proto expression trees.

description.para: A PolymorphicFunctionObject for deep-copying Proto expression trees. When a tree is deep-copied, all internal nodes and most terminals held by reference are instead held by value.

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/domain.hpp
header.para: Contains definition of domain<> class template and helpers for defining domains with a generator and a grammar for controlling operator overloading.

struct.name: domain
struct.purpose: For use in defining domain tags to be used with proto::extends<>. A Domain associates an expression type with a Generator, and optionally a Grammar.

description.para: The Generator determines how new expressions in the domain are constructed. Typically, a generator wraps all new expressions in a wrapper that imparts domain-specific behaviors to expressions within its domain. (See proto::extends<>.)

The Grammar determines whether a given expression is valid within the domain, and automatically disables any operator overloads which would cause an invalid expression to be created. By default, the Grammar parameter defaults to the wildcard, proto::_, which makes all expressions valid within the domain.

struct.name: default_domain
struct.purpose: The domain expressions have by default, if proto::extends<> has not been used to associate a domain with an expression.

struct.name: deduce_domain
struct.purpose: A pseudo-domain for use in functions and metafunctions that require a domain parameter. It indicates that the domain of the parent node should be inferred from the domains of the children nodes.

description.para: A metafunction that returns mpl::true_ if the type T is the type of a Proto domain; mpl::false_ otherwise. If T inherits from proto::domain<>, is_domain<T> is mpl::true_.
A metafunction that returns the domain of a given type. If T is a Proto expression type, it returns that expression's associated domain. If not, it returns proto::default_domain.

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/eval.hpp
header.para: Contains the eval() expression evaluator.

struct.name: eval
struct.purpose: A PolymorphicFunctionObject type for evaluating a given Proto expression with a given context.

typedef.name: type
typedef.type: proto::result_of::eval< typename remove_reference< Expr >::type, typename remove_reference< Context >::type >::type

method.name: operator()
method.purpose: Evaluate a given Proto expression with a given context.

description.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

struct.name: eval
struct.purpose: A metafunction for calculating the return type of proto::eval() given a certain Expr and Context types.

data-member.name: eval
data-member.purpose: A PolymorphicFunctionObject for evaluating a given Proto expression with a given context.

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/expr.hpp
header.para: Contains definition of expr<> class template.

struct-specialization.name: expr
struct-specialization.purpose: Representation of a node in an expression tree.

description.para: proto::expr<> is a node in an expression template tree. It is a container for its children sub-trees. It also serves as the terminal nodes of the tree.

Tag is type that represents the operation encoded by this expression. It is typically one of the structs in the boost::proto::tag namespace, but it doesn't have to be. If the Tag type is boost::proto::tag::terminal then this expr<> type represents a leaf in the expression tree.

Args is a type list representing the type of the children of this expression. It is an instantiation of one of proto::args1<>, proto::args2<>, etc. The children types must all themselves be either expr<> or proto::ref_<proto::expr<>>, unless the Tag type is boost::proto::tag::terminal, in which case Args must be proto::args0<T>, where T can be any type.
proto::expr<> is a valid Fusion random-access sequence, where the elements of the sequence are the children expressions.
Encodes the return type of expr<>operator(), for use with boost::result_of<>

returns.para: *this

description.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

method.name: operator[]
method.type: proto::expr< proto::tag::subscript, args2< ref_< expr const >, typename result_of::as_arg< A >::type > > const

description.para: The rhs.
Subscript

returns.para: A new expr<> node representing *this subscripted with a.

method.type: proto::expr< proto::tag::subscript, args2< ref_< expr const >, typename result_of::as_arg< A const >::type > > const

struct-specialization.name: expr
struct-specialization.purpose: Representation of a node in an expression tree.

description.para: proto::expr<> is a node in an expression template tree. It is a container for its children sub-trees. It also serves as the terminal nodes of the tree.

Tag is type that represents the operation encoded by this expression. It is typically one of the structs in the boost::proto::tag namespace, but it doesn't have to be. If the Tag type is boost::proto::tag::terminal then this expr<> type represents a leaf in the expression tree.

Args is a type list representing the type of the children of this expression. It is an instantiation of one of proto::args1<>, proto::args2<>, etc. The children types must all themselves be either expr<> or proto::ref_<proto::expr<>>, unless the Tag type is boost::proto::tag::terminal, in which case Args must be proto::args0<T>, where T can be any type.
proto::expr<> is a valid Fusion random-access sequence, where the elements of the sequence are the children expressions.
Encodes the return type of expr<>operator(), for use with boost::result_of<>
If Tag is boost::proto::tag::address_of and proto_arg0 is proto::ref_<T>, then address_of_hack_type_ is T*. Otherwise, it is some undefined type.

returns.para: *this

description.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

returns.para: The address of this->arg0 if Tag is boost::proto::tag::address_of. Otherwise, this function will fail to compile.

notes.para: Proto overloads operator&, which means that proto-ified objects cannot have their addresses taken, unless we use the following hack to make &x implicitly convertible to X*.

returns.para: A new expr<> object initialized with the specified arguments.

struct-specialization.name: expr
struct-specialization.purpose: Representation of a node in an expression tree.

description.para: proto::expr<> is a node in an expression template tree. It is a container for its children sub-trees. It also serves as the terminal nodes of the tree.

Tag is type that represents the operation encoded by this expression. It is typically one of the structs in the boost::proto::tag namespace, but it doesn't have to be. If the Tag type is boost::proto::tag::terminal then this expr<> type represents a leaf in the expression tree.

Args is a type list representing the type of the children of this expression. It is an instantiation of one of proto::args1<>, proto::args2<>, etc. The children types must all themselves be either expr<> or proto::ref_<proto::expr<>>, unless the Tag type is boost::proto::tag::terminal, in which case Args must be proto::args0<T>, where T can be any type.
proto::expr<> is a valid Fusion random-access sequence, where the elements of the sequence are the children expressions.
Encodes the return type of expr<>operator(), for use with boost::result_of<>

returns.para: *this

description.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

method.name: operator[]
method.type: proto::expr< proto::tag::subscript, args2< ref_< expr const >, typename result_of::as_arg< A >::type > > const

description.para: The rhs.
Subscript

returns.para: A new expr<> node representing *this subscripted with a.

method.name: operator[]
method.type: proto::expr< proto::tag::subscript, args2< ref_< expr const >, typename result_of::as_arg< A const >::type > > const

description.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

method.name: operator()
method.type: proto::expr< proto::tag::function, args1< ref_< expr const > > > const

struct.purpose: Empty type to be used as a dummy template parameter of POD expression wrappers. It allows argument-dependent lookup to find Proto's operator overloads.

description.para: proto::is_proto_expr allows argument-dependent lookup to find Proto's operator overloads. For example:
Without the second Dummy template parameter, Proto's operator overloads would not be considered by name lookup.

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/fusion.hpp
header.para: Make any Proto expression a valid Fusion sequence

struct.name: flatten
struct.purpose: A PolymorphicFunctionObject type that returns a "flattened" view of a Proto expression tree.

description.para: A PolymorphicFunctionObject type that returns a "flattened" view of a Proto expression tree. For a tree with a top-most node tag of type T, the elements of the flattened sequence are determined by recursing into each child node with the same tag type and returning those nodes of different type. So for instance, the Proto expression tree corresponding to the expression a | b | c has a flattened view with elements [a, b, c], even though the tree is grouped as ((a | b) | c).

struct.name: pop_front
struct.purpose: A PolymorphicFunctionObject type that invokes the fusion::pop_front() algorithm on its argument.

description.para: A PolymorphicFunctionObject type that invokes the fusion::pop_front() algorithm on its argument. This is useful for defining a CallableTransform like pop_front(_) which removes the first child from a Proto expression node. Such a transform might be used as the first argument to the proto::transform::fold<> transform; that is, fold all but the first child.

struct.name: reverse
struct.purpose: A PolymorphicFunctionObject type that invokes the fusion::reverse() algorithm on its argument.

description.para: A PolymorphicFunctionObject type that invokes the fusion::reverse() algorithm on its argument. This is useful for defining a CallableTransform like reverse(_) which reverses the order of the children of a Proto expression node.

data-member.name: flatten
data-member.purpose: A PolymorphicFunctionObject type that returns a "flattened" view of a Proto expression tree.

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/generate.hpp
header.para: Contains definition of generate<> class template, which end users can specialize for generating domain-specific expression wrappers.

struct.name: default_generator
struct.purpose: A simple generator that passes an expression through unchanged.

description.para: Generators are intended for use as the first template parameter to the domain<> class template and control if and how expressions within that domain are to be customized. The default_generator makes no modifications to the expressions passed to it.
A Proto expression

returns.para: expr

struct.name: generator
struct.purpose: A generator that wraps expressions passed to it in the specified extension wrapper.

description.para: Generators are intended for use as the first template parameter to the domain<> class template and control if and how expressions within that domain are to be customized. generator<> wraps each expression passed to it in the Extends<> wrapper.
A Proto expression

returns.para: Extends<Expr>(expr)

struct.name: pod_generator
struct.purpose: A generator that wraps expressions passed to it in the specified extension wrapper and uses aggregate initialization for the wrapper.

description.para: Generators are intended for use as the first template parameter to the domain<> class template and control if and how expressions within that domain are to be customized. pod_generator<> wraps each expression passed to it in the Extends<> wrapper, and uses aggregate initialzation for the wrapped object.
The expression to wrap

returns.para: Extends<Expr> that = {expr}; return that;

struct.name: by_value_generator
struct.purpose: A composite generator that first replaces child nodes held by reference with ones held by value and then forwards the result on to another generator.

description.para: Generators are intended for use as the first template parameter to the domain<> class template and control if and how expressions within that domain are to be customized. by_value_generator<> ensures all children nodes are held by value before forwarding the expression on to another generator for further processing. The Generator parameter defaults to default_generator.
The expression to modify.

returns.para: Generator::make(deep_copy(expr))

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/literal.hpp
header.para: The literal<> terminal wrapper, and the proto::lit() function for creating literal<> wrappers.

struct.name: literal
struct.purpose: A simple wrapper for a terminal, provided for ease of use.

description.para: A simple wrapper for a terminal, provided for ease of use. In all cases, literal<X> l(x); is equivalent to terminal<X>type l = {x};.
The Domain template parameter defaults to proto::default_domain.

overloaded-function.name: lit

signature.type: literal< T & >

description.para: The object to wrap.

signature.type: literal< T const & >

overloaded-function.purpose: A helper function for creating a literal<> wrapper.

returns.para: literal<T &>(t)

notes.para: The returned value holds the argument by reference.

typedef.name: type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< Fun(typename when< _, Arg0 >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type, typename when< _, Arg1 >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type, typename when< _, Arg2 >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type)>::type

typedef.name: type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< Fun(typename when< _, A0 >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type, typename when< _, A1 >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type, typename when< _, A2 >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type, typename when< _, A3 >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type)>::type

typedef.name: type
typedef.type: boost::result_of< Fun(typename when< _, A0 >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type, typename when< _, A1 >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type, typename when< _, A2 >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type, typename when< _, A3 >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type, typename when< _, A4 >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type)>::type

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/transform/fold.hpp
header.para: Contains definition of the fold<> and reverse_fold<> transforms.

typedef.name: sequence
typedef.type: when< _, Sequence >::template result< void(Expr, State, Visitor) >::type

description.para: This specialization is only for improved compile-time performance in the commom case when the Sequence transform is proto::_.
INTERNAL ONLY
This specialization is only for improved compile-time performance in the commom case when the Sequence transform is proto::_.
INTERNAL ONLY

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/transform/make.hpp
header.para: Contains definition of the make<> transform.

header.name: boost/xpressive/proto/transform/when.hpp
header.para: Definition of when transform.

typedef.name: impl
typedef.type: mpl::if_< is_callable< Return >, call< Return() >, make< Return() > >::type

typedef.name: impl
typedef.type: mpl::if_< is_callable< Return >, call< Return(A0) >, make< Return(A0) > >::type

typedef.name: impl
typedef.type: mpl::if_< is_callable< Return >, call< Return(A0, A1) >, make< Return(A0, A1) > >::type

typedef.name: impl
typedef.type: mpl::if_< is_callable< Return >, call< Return(A0, A1, A2) >, make< Return(A0, A1, A2) > >::type

typedef.name: impl
typedef.type: mpl::if_< is_callable< Return >, call< Return(A0, A1, A2, A3) >, make< Return(A0, A1, A2, A3) > >::type

typedef.name: impl
typedef.type: mpl::if_< is_callable< Return >, call< Return(A0, A1, A2, A3, A4) >, make< Return(A0, A1, A2, A3, A4) > >::type
